It doesn't hurt that the smell of freshly made waffle cones lulls you into complacency.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Very good but coming here wasn't the same magical experience as the Portland location for some reason. Line was long and moved slowly, cones are superb, scoops are generous (if pricey), service was kind. 

I had honey lavender and sea salt caramel on a cone. $8.50 and I ate about half and saved the rest for tomorrow (large portion). They are patient with samples and have cool little dirty spoon receptacles under the counter. Not much seating inside so get your cone and walk around the nabe. Pints are $11 and you can skip the line with one. 

Overall, I probably won't venture here and wait in line unless I'm in the area. Ice cream is above average but visiting the Portland location was really fun and maybe the ice cream there tasted better after waiting an hour in the rain for it ;)
author: Semuteh F.

description:
We came here mid afternoon on a Sunday and there was a line out the door (but no line when we left!). I can see why there's a line - it's the service they give to each customer. They ask if you've ever been here before and breaks down the popular flavors and asks you which ones you want to sample. I opted for a kiddie size of the roasted strawberry tres leches ice cream in a waffle cone. That cone is made fresh and it makes the store smell so delicious! The ice cream sounds so gourmet but when you break down it's just strawberry ice cream with cake chunks in it --- I know this make it sound super unexciting but it was the best strawberry ice cream I've ever had (and the best selling flavor in SF supposedly). It wasn't overly sweet and the strawberry flavor was subtle and he tres leches offer a great texture and element to complement the strawberry. I actually prefer this one to their ever popular sea salt caramel flavor. 

I highly recommend this place and my only regret is not getting a bigger size!
author: Maggie W.

description: In Hayes Valley, this is my preferred ice cream place over some of the other places. I like that they have unique flavors and a lot of choices and the way it usually always smells like fresh waffle cones. Usually they have a line out the door though so try to come at non-peak times. I have my standards like the honey lavender, sea salt with caramel and the strawberry tres leches. But usually I like to try their flavors of the month - this last month, I had the sweet corn and waffle. It didn't have that much of a corn flavor but I liked the waffle bits in it. I think I've also tried the chocolate caramel potato chip cupcake and the weird thanksgiving and Christmas flavors. The waffle cone is usually a must for me also. I like it. But it is pricey for ice cream - though it is artisan ice cream, whatever that means. Haha.
author: Alison W.

description:
The Salt & Straw in Hayes street is so wonderful. The customer service is amazing and they allow you to try any flavor you would like. They have a variety of unique flavors on their menu. For those who have a heavy sweet tooth, they have very rich chocolate flavors and for those who don't, they have less decadent flavors to satisfy people with drastically different tastes. I came here at around 3 pm on a Tuesday with a group of 8 others and there was no line. There was enough flavors for all of us to get something different that we liked individually. I tried a few flavors including the honey lavender which is a very popular flavor. I ended up getting a scoop of sea salt with caramel ribbon on a cone and it was delicious! It was basically their vanilla with swirls of caramel but their vanilla ice cream had a salty hint to It. Overall delicious and delightful with the cone.

Price:
one scoop: $5 
kids scoops: $4
one scoop + cone: $6.25

I HIGHLY recommended getting the cone with whatever flavor you decide to get!
author: Denise M.

description:
I was excited to try out salt & straw after hearing about it from everybody. My friends and I had bookmarked the Fillmore location but then accidentally stumbled upon this place. Less walking and same results? Score! We got to sample multiple flavors without the pressure of making a hasty decision since there was no one behind us - I guess that's what happens when you grab ice cream at 11 in the morning and it's less than 55 degrees outside. 

I ended up getting the single scoop and splitting that into two flavors - they charge you extra for that but when you can't choose, treat yourself and get the best of both worlds! I got the apple brandy and pecan pie, which was a holiday flavor, and the olive oil and lemon custard. Both were good flavors though I'll admit that the apple brandy and pecan pie definitely sweeted me out.

One of my friends got the honey lavender - you could REALLY taste the lavender here - and my other friend got the carmelized grapefruit eggnog (which was another special flavor for the holidays) and LOVED IT. She literally could not stop talking about it the whole day. The day after, she was still dreaming about it.

Would absolutely recommend trying the flavors out here. There's so many to choose from! Will admit that their scoops weren't too even. They skimped out on one of the cones (as you can see in the pics). THAT AIN'T RIGHT.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
The perfection of the service and ice cream more than compensates for the obscene length of the line. If you're in a hurry, this isn't the place for you, because a 10-min wait is almost guaranteed. However, the smiling hostess (where do you ever meet those in SF?!) took me completely be surprise -- she asked about our food allergies, recommended flavors, and encouraged us to try samples. You can order a split scoop for an extra 50 cents to try two flavors while keeping the portion size relatively reasonable. Highly recommend the chewy brownie and strawberry tres leches flavors on the regular menu. 

One potential con: if you like classic flavors, like simple chocolate or vanilla or strawberry, you won't really find that here. The USP of Salt & Straw is their wacky flavors -- if you'd like a classic chocolate, I'd recommend Smitten Ice Cream just two blocks down the road.
author: Neha S.

description: The ice cream here is great , my favorite is defiantly strawberry Tres leche!  My girlfriend always gets the vegan options and they are also also so good. I  wanted to take the time and write a review because the customer service was over the top.  I believed the girl who helped us name was Lima. She is sooo great !  She helped us try different flavors and warned us about things we might not like. Thank you Lima !  We would defiantly be back because of you !
author: Juanita H.

description:
Discovered this gem when walking through Hayes Valley. And what a difference between this location and the one on Fillmore (which seems to always have a long line). There were only three people ahead of me at this location and I was surprised at how quickly the line moved! During the winter time, they had some fun holiday flavors including peppermint mocha, gingerbread, etc. A new flavor caught my eye which was the vegan strawberry coconut. After tasting it, I was hooked and would highly recommend this flavor - it was a little more on the lighter side on my opinion. 

And PS - one scoop will definitely be enough ice cream for you!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Aw man what a bummer. I went to LA & SF on vacation. Tried Jeni's & McConnell's in LA but decided to save the ice cream Mecca of the west coast for last. I got up at 7:30 in the morning and went on an urban hike throughout the city thinking about how good this ice cream would taste. Racking up the steps hiking up those damn hills so I could open up the calorie bank for this indulgence.

6pm I have arrived. I'm overwhelmed with options but luckily I did my research beforehand. I sampled the carrot cake, cheesey shit, olive oil, and a bunch of other off-the-wall flavors. Y'all....this was like the la croix of ice cream. I literally could not taste the flavor I was supposed to be tasting. Were my taste buds broken? The flavor was ridiculously faint in every sample I got. I was the most disappointed in the olive oil flavor. I only settled on the dandelion hazelnut chocolate cookies & cream + salted malted chocolate chip cookie dough because they were the best out of like, 7 flavor samples and I didn't want to walk out after the accommodating ice cream girl let me try so many.

I'm not upset that I tried it, but I am sad that what I discovered was overhyped nonsense :(
author: Anna N.

description:
Super excited that there's a Salt&Straw in the city, slightly scared that it's in such close vicinity to me (winter bod is going to come sooner than planned). 

Always love an ice cream shop that serves up interesting and unusual flavors. My friends and I waited in line (its long so be prepared to wait because everyone wants to sample) and took our time sampling a few flavors. I had a scoop of the strawberry tres leches which is everything you'd want in an ice cream and more, so good! It's a little pricey but you're paying for good quality ice cream - worth it! So many flavors so little time, I'll be back!
author: Renu A.

description:
Sooo goood!!! We've been to the one in Portland which was amazing (see my review there). 

Had the chocolate gooey brownie and olive oil in a cone bowl which was sooooo goooood. Sampled a few (the rhubarb, dark chocolate, almond brittle) which were good but didn't take the cake for me. 

Looking forward to trying some more!
author: Laura D.

description:
I have been to the Portland location and loved this place so I was super excited when it was opening in SF!

This location is super cute, has a great interior and the staff is very friendly.  Fortunately the line was not long so we did not feel bad trying numerous flavors and the lady was super nice.  She told us what made the ice cream, like the almond brittle was an almond brittle recipe that is a secret recipe from the owner's grandma or something like that.  It made it feel more special.  

They have special flavors each month, we were there in November so it was Thanksgiving flavors. 

They have a wide selection and everything we tried were so good but our top favorites were roasted strawberry tres leches (they said that is the top seller and only available in SF), olive oil and lemon custard, and almond brittle.
author: Lauren S.

description: Salt & Straw is my favorite ice cream in San Francisco. I first discovered Salt & Straw when I visited Portland and when I found out that they had a location in San Francisco, I was ecstatic! I've been to this location a handful of times now and I've never been disappointed. Though you might have to wait in line for 20 minutes or so, it's totally worth it. The service here is incredible and you should not be shy about asking for samples of their flavors. It doesn't make a sense for me to list my favorite seasonal favorites because it probably won't be available when you read my review, but rest assured, there's so much variety at Salt & Straw, there's something for everyone's palette. If you're a tourist in San Francisco and am looking for some awesome ice cream, skip out on Ghirardelli, Humphry Slocombe, and Smittens and come here instead.
author: Austin W.

description: I cannot emphasize enough how much I love this place. I've been to this one and the LA one now, but still have yet to go in Portland  but WOW. So fresh, and I love how they use local ingredients. I sampled 4 different flavors, which included a matcha with black raspberry, strawberry with some kind of cake, carrot cake, and San Francisco's Owen vegan Dandelion Chocolate with Oreos and made from coconut milk. It was hard to decide because they were all so delicious, but the strawberry stuck out to me because I loved the little pieces of cake inside and the flavor of the fruit was so fresh. I honestly could've stayed there trying flavors much longer, especially as they're really kind and have unlimited samples, but I felt bad for the people waiting behind me, because I knew they were probably just as excited as me to get my ice cream! Next time I'll definitely try more. They even have flavors with vegetables in them, as I'm sure they're still amazing. We had to wait about 10 minutes, so it wasn't too bad, and despite the steep price, it's definitely worth it. There's Smitten across the street, which is good and fresh, but only if you're into the liquid nitrogen hype  wish there was a Salt and Straw closer to come, but it's probably for the best that it's far away or I'd be there all the time! We got the fresh waffle cone bowls which were also delectable. Can't wait to come back!
author: Carlie C.

description:
Ice cream you're supposed to eat with your pinkie out! 

Just joking, it's not a pretentious ice cream shop but it is a fancy, gourmet ice cream that has unique flavors occasionally serves savory ice cream in addition to the sweet based flavors. Of course there was a line but it's worth the wait and the line does move fairly quickly. It's a cute shop and they let you sample any flavor you want. I tried a few including the gooey brownie, tres leches strawberry and a dark cocoa that had a smoky component. They were are good and represented well with their flavor profiles. One of my barometers for the best ice cream shops are fresh waffle cones and I can say Salt & Straw has a delicious waffle cone. Of course I'm greedy so I adorned it with two large scoops and my taste buds/stomach thoroughly thanked me for that decision. In my book you can't beat craft ice cream...maybe with delicious baked goods but this is some amazing ice cream! It worth checking out and when you love it come back for the ever changing flavors!
author: Sean F.

description:
+unimaginable and tasty flavor combos
-black spoons are not compostable. It would be great for such a busy icecream chain to be environmentally responsible
author: Veggie F.

description:
This ice cream is hands down the best I've ever had (and I consider myself to be a bit of an ice cream connoisseur) and I think it's broadly known fact.  So although I don't think they need another review validating the quality and overall deliciousness of their flavors I feel compelled to praise my thanks!  

When I moved out to the Bay Area a couple years ago, I made it a point to try all of the ice cream shops in SF.  And there are an ample amount to get through!  I had been to at least ten spots when S&S opened up on Fillmore and since the day I first sampled their Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches I was hooked and have suspended my ice cream tour.  I completed the mission and found the very best at S&S.

It's rare for me to spend a day in the city without a perfectly rounded scoop.  Sometimes I even commute into the city solely for the purpose of obtaining some heavenly ice cream or sampling the newest seasonal flavors!  The staff is always extremely friendly and always willing to provide as many samples as it takes to pick the perfect flavor.  I have stood in many a line outside of their shops and I have never felt that it wasn't well worth my time.

Recently, I got engaged and convinced my fiance to take some of our engagement photos with ice cream, and, of course, it had to be S&S.  We want to say a special thank you to the manager, Skyla, for hooking us up with the most beautiful double scoop that served as a fun and delicious prop for our pics.  Thank you,  Skyla!! So glad to make S&S a part of our engagement memories forever:)

Pro tip: sample your heart out, then go with Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches because it IS the best. Don't sleep on the waffle cones.  Their t-shirts are the softest and worth the investment.
author: Caroline R.

description:
Honestly you'll never have ice cream like the one at salt and straw. The flavors are all original and they have a limited time rotation of flavors monthly along with core flavors available all the time.

The price is not that bad and you're getting quality ice cream. You can even buy it by the pint. They practically beg you to sample everything you want so you're guaranteed to walk out with something you love. If you go during peak and see a line, don't be discouraged they're well staffed and the line moves quickly.
author: Roy C.

description:
After a long day of walking up and down San Francisco's hills, my tummy was hankering for a sweet treat. I'd earned the calories, after all.

After dinner, my cousin brought us to Salt & Straw. And oh man, was it worth it.

I was visiting from Chicago, so I was hoping to visit a good local ice cream joint. And this did not disappoint.

Fave flavors: Strawberry Tres Leches (*droool*), and Vanilla+Peach combo.

Check this spot out!
author: Hassan A.

description:
I love this place and do not miss any opportunity to have ice cream of the month here. They keep changing the menu yet they have some classes which are always available. 

Their chocolate fudge brownie in classics is a must have if you are a chocolate lover. Their monthly menus are always interesting and you should always try them. 

Must must must go!!!
Also: if you don't wanna stand in a line , yes there is always a line. So, if you don't wanna stand in a line buy the pint. The only problem is throwing does not have all the flavors so you really need to know what you want and if a pint is available with that flavor, enjoy!
author: Ramyata M.

description:
About 5 different people raved that Salt & Straw was the best ice cream in SF, so obviously I had to go try it. It really is that good.

I went on a Saturday afternoon, so the line was a bit long but it took us no more than 10 minutes to get to the front. We were encouraged to try as many flavors as we wanted. I ended up getting the Sea Salt with Caramel in a waffle cup which was truly amazing and very rich in the best way.

Parking is a bit of a hassle just because it is Hayes Valley, but the ice cream is worth it. Definitely try all the flavors before deciding!
author: Sama R.

description:
Delicious ice cream! I've been waiting to try this. 

Cute chalkboard menu with great font and illustrations! Quirky yet prompt service, eager to give out samples and the flavors were all so unique. I tried the Berkeley olive oil, fig and Madagascar chocolate, cookie dough and dandelion s'mores. 

My favorite was the dandelion smore it was so unique, the flavor was somewhere between honeycomb and cinnamon. My second fav trailing right behind was the fig/Madagascar chocolate-like omg dark fruity chocolate chunks that melt in your mouth! 

All the ice cream was packed with flavor and it was amazingly thick, like custard. 

Overall. Highly recommend this to anyone wanting to try something above the average ice cream shop.
author: Megan K.

description: The line outside is worth the wait! Love all the natural flavors. The lavender and cookie dough ice cream was amazing!
author: Yasmine D.

description: Really really wanted to like this place but just....didn't. I wish I understood the hype behind this place because honestly the ice cream was just not that great. I sampled two ice creams, the coffee w/dandelion chocolate and then the salted malted cookie dough. I really didn't like either, but went with the coffee flavor. The place was packed around 8pm on a Thursday night. Also, the flavors really just seemed gross. I saw goat cheese and olive, I'm sorry but what? That's not something that sounds appealing to anyone. This place really tries to be hipster and the vibe is something I'm not really into. Maybe this place will get the typical SF Vibe but if they try to put this coffee place somewhere like Las Vegas I truly think it would not do too hot.
author: Angelica B.

description: Had a scoop of chocolate brownie in a waffle cone.  Too much brownie in the ice cream for my taste.  The chocolate itself was good but it was held back by the way-too-many brownie chunks.  The waffle cone itself must be about 9-10 inches from top to bottom.  And to the servers credit, it had ice cream in the entire length of the cone. I thought the flavor choices were all in all too over the top.  They could use to add more simple flavors along with their "exotic" recipes.  Wouldn't go back.
author: Courtney A.

description: One of the best Ice creams I've had. We were regulars at the Portland salt and straw! HUGE FANS as we were , we Tried every flavor at the pdx store  multiple times and loved it all. Pleasantly surprised to find a branch in San Fran, we were quick to test the waters. Everything about this store, The ambience, the long lines , incredible customer service - took us back to Portland ! Everything except the menu. They had changed the menu to suit the sf taste buds and we strongly felt that was a mistake ! How can you not have the signature "almond brittle with chocolate ganache" and the "pear and blue cheese" icecreams on the menu ! Was happy to find the "honey lavender" which tasted exactly the same as the Portland version ! Loved it to bits . We sampled a couple of the flavors here but nothing really stood out. Maybe we were tell biased to begin with :) definitely great ice creams just doesn't match the Portland one :)
author: Benita B.

description:
This place is insane.

I am not even a huge ice cream person and I still cannot get over my ice cream experience here when I was visiting San Francisco.

They have lots of unique flavors to choose from and they really don't care if you just stand there and try them all--not that I did that or anything, I'm just saying, hypothetically. 

But then, I tried the apple-brandy crumble. And it was like a magical fairy just gave me the key to happiness. It was creamy and delicious. The apple crumble that they put in is INSANE. It's so flavorful, tastes as if it was just baked for you with the greatest ice cream in the world.

If you are in San Francisco, this place is a MUST.
author: Galit T.

description: Salt & Straw offers the most unique flavors and I highly recommend checking it out! The first time I tried it was in LA and I got Creme Brûlée. It was so good but too sweet. Many of the flavors are very sweet so try before you order. They don't skimp on testers too! They also have ice cream flights for $11.50!! Pictured (from back to front): Lemon Meringue, Caramel Ribbons (strong burnt caramel taste but very good), Strawberry Tres Leches (fave) and Malt Chocolate cookie dough!
author: Caitlyn S.

description: I would definitely recommend a visit here if you love good service and delicious ice cream! The person who served me was very friendly and helpful. She let me know what flavors were the most popular and let me test a few flavors. As for the ice cream. they also had very unique flavors, most of which I haven't seen at other shops. Also I'm not vegan but they had more than 5 different options which is pretty legit. Of all the flavors I tried, the ice cream consistency was perfectly smooth and creamy. The only downside is that it was a bit pricey, but worth it!
author: Jacqueline T.

description: Whoa this place will brighten anyone's day! They let you sample all their delicious flavors which makes it hard to make a final decision. I choose the Sweet Corn & Waffle Cone flavor and had it as a shake! I'm so happy to have come across this place! Do try it!
author: Julianne O.

description: Great selection of flavors, a lot of unique imaginative ones, and some of them change every month. Worst part is it gets really busy sometimes, but thats because its so good. Good staff, generous with samples.
author: Dave D.

description: Love the strawberry tres leches cake ice cream that's only available at their sf location. I get this every time. However this time the ratio of strawberry jam: ice cream was off - too much jam (at the bottom of the scoop) and way too sweet :( guess you have to get the lucky scoop with the right ratio
author: Weich Y.

description:
Second SF S&S location, same great ice cream and people!

As usual, sample as much as you need to - as I was told, "all 18 flavors if you so choose".  I sampled 5 before making up my mind, and the samples were very generous spoons.

For $5.50 I got a split scoop of sea salt with caramel ribbons and almond brittle with salted ganache on a sugar cone.  What can I say, I love my salt.  Delicious as usual.
author: Brent T.

description: A little more expensive than what I'm used to, but so worth it! It's a lot like Jeni's from the midwest/southeast. I got the freckled woodblock chocolate, which was salted, and the chocolate gooey brownie, which lives up to its name with its thickness and chewy brownie bits. The double scoop was HUGE, and the homemade waffle cone was decent too (not as good as Jeni's though).
author: Alice Z.

description:
They had "vegan January" which was amazing. They had 4-5 types of vegan ice cream. It looks like their vegan selection isn't as wide anymore but I found this vegan strawberry coconut pint which tastes soooo good. 
They also have peanut vegan options for peanut lovers.
author: Sevda G.

description: Incredible dairy-free ice cream - arguably some of the best I've ever had. I'm glad I had a chance try Salt & Straw when I did, the whole experience was an unexpectedly pleasant one. The customer service was on point, the space was big enough where I didn't feel crowded inside and rushed out (unlike most ice cream spots) - but a huge plus is how close Salt and Straw is to a relatively nice area to sit and enjoy the sun. I'll visit whenever I'm back in SF.
author: Morgen B.

description:
Salt & Straw is located in Hayes Valley and definitely adhered to the cute and fancy aesthetic of the surrounding stores. The flavors here were extremely unique. Tokyo PB&J, Roasted Beets, Berkeley Olive Grove, etc. I got the double scoop in a waffle cone and it was large enough to serve as my dinner!

[ honey lavendar ] I loved the light, flowery taste. The texture was very creamy but not super heavy. It was very nice on the palette.

[ chocolate gooey browni ] This was amazingly thick. The brownie chunks were extremely chewy and were the highlight of this my entire ice cream cone.
author: Annie Z.

description:
The texture of these ice-creams.


---- EVERYDAY ----

Vanilla: 5 stars

Almond Brittle and Salt Ganache: 4 stars


---- SPECIALS ----

Dick Tayler's Black Fig and Madagascar Chocolate: 4 stars
February Chocolatier special. Super decadent with the rich fig, salt, and creamy chocolate base. Not too chocolatey.

Strawberry Yoghurt Almond: 4 stars
author: Letitia L.

description:
Unique and wide variety of ice cream flavors. Handmade waffle cones made in front you. Plus a cute atmosphere and great location!

The texture plus creaminess aren't the best to me, but still up there!
author: Michelle B.

description:
Came here on a friend's recommendation. We were lucky there was no line after lunch on a Sunday. The 
Honey lavender was so delicious and on par with bi-rite. I will definitely be back
author: Sophia L.

description: Oh my goodness . Their salted caramel on a wee waffle cone . If you have not tried , you are seriously missing out . You can smell the waffle and the ice cream a block down ! Customer service is great and their Ice cream is heaven . I always get the salted caramel but they have limited time offers that I usually try . BUT SO FAR... NOTHING BEATS THE SALTED CARAMEL !
author: Dee N.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream bc WE LOVE SALT & STRAW. Seriously so ecstatic when I realized that Salt & Straw had opened up a location in SF! I've been to the one in Portland before, and I waited over an hour in line for ice cream there. It was worth it. SO worth it. At this location, I waited probably about 15 minutes in line on a Sunday afternoon, somehow beat the ice cream rush. it was fantastic.

This location is in Hayes Valley, the space is a lot smaller than the Portland location obviously but it's cute, hip, trendy, everything you'd want in a boutique ice cream shop.The staff are friendly and offer you samples of whatever you want while you make your way up to the line to order. They of course have an amazing selection of flavors. I love that they use ingredients like Sightglass Coffee or Dandelion chocolate that are local to SF. I got the Sightglass coffee flavor and UNNNNFFF SO GOOD. Creamy, delicious, rich. Everything you'd want in ice cream.Waffle cones could be better but that's my only qualm. They have some pretty wacky flavors which are fun to try but I usually just stick with coffee, chocolate, or minty types of flavors. They had thanksgiving flavors when I was there and some of them even incorporated real meat which was interesting. I love Salt & Straw. One of my favorite ice cream places EVER.
author: Amy T.

description:
Roasted strawberry tres leche ice cream?? Yes please! I'm usually a salted caramel kind of girl but i had a sample and immediately knew I had to get a scoop in a freshly made waffle bowl. 

Note: Lines can get long because it takes them forever to give people samples!! Which you understand when you're the one sampling bc there are so many unique flavors you'll want to try...

Subtle, creamy, good. Yum :)
author: Juliet K.

description: About a year ago, I visited the salt and straw location in Portland.  After visiting the this location, I can safely say that the Portland ice cream shop safely made the trip to SF! As soon as you walk into this cozy ice cream shop, you are greeted with hellos as you wait in line for your turn.  Your ice cream "barista" walks around the counter and guides you to where your ice cream experience starts.  There, you can sample as many ice cream flavors as you want guided by your barista.  They offer insights like good paring combinations and popular flavors.  Once you've finally made your decision, you pay and enjoy your ice cream (assuming you haven't finished it from the short walk from the counter to the cashier). The flavors are great (with the toasted strawberry being a "CA exclusive flavor") and their baristas are friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Alex J.

description: Salt & Straw in Hayes Valley is the perfect indulgence if you are catching a show at the Symphony or the Orpheum; we visited three times in four weeks because we couldn't get enough! I have been a fan since I visited them in Portland and love many of their flavors, but the incredible stand-out to both me and my wife was the maple sweet potato with pecans. Brought in for Thanksgiving, this flavor thankfully stayed on the menu straight through Christmas. It is incredibly complex, with a nice full body and a beautiful mix of savoriness and sweetness. It really didn't need any sauces or toppings, and the line was always very short at this location (less than 20 minutes in the late afternoon), a welcome change from the Valencia and Portland locations.
author: Vijay N.

description:
I can't think of a time Salt & Straw doesn't deserve five stars. The creativity is unrivaled, and the set of rotating monthly flavors always keeps me coming back to try the latest invention on the menu. Their regular flavors are great as well (strawberry is my personal fav), and if you can't make up your mind, grab a friend and try four flavors in a flight. Never too sweet but always smooth, rich, and creamy, the ice cream hits the spot every time.
Salt & Straw also consistently has the best service. Employees seem to genuinely enjoy working there, and trying too many flavors is never a problem.
author: Amy C.

description:
Salt & Straw is my favorite ice cream store in the country. The inventive flavors are made with local ingredients and they excel at both dairy and non-dairy ice creams. The store encourages sampling which I particularly enjoy. 
This particular location has more space than the Pac Heights store and, therefore, when there's a line it isn't an unpleasant experience. 
I go out of my way to go to this Salt & Straw and always find myself bringing a pint home to enjoy later.
author: Lauren B.

description:
WOW. I mean, wow. The best ice cream I've ever had. From the way it is prepared to the flavors that they have. The creaminess and fluffiness of the whipped ice cream is unique, you can definitely tell it's made with quality. There's not much to say about ice cream but there's a reason this place is such a great reputation, it's not just for the hype! When I came here I got the waffle cone with two scoops, one salted melted chocolate cookie dough and one roasted strawberries with tres leches.

This was probably the hardest decision I've ever made! There were so many great and unique flavors I honestly wanted to try them all. The chocolate chip cookie dough was delicious, the cookie dough had a little bit of chocolates in it that looked like sesame seeds, but black. It was fresh and chewy and awesome. The roasted strawberry tres leches what my favorite! And this is coming from someone who is a chocolate lover. The strawberries were whole and it was like giant scoops of jam were placed in the ice cream, I've never tasted anything like it! The other half of the scoop was like biting into a cake...and I don't mean cake batter or cookie dough, I mean an actually fluffy cake that is somehow not frozen and a part of this ice cream flavor! That's the only way I can describe it. It's amazing! Definitely my new favorite.
author: Alejandra A.

description:
Wandering through Hayes Valley and stumbled across this new ice cream shop! It was around Thanksgiving and was cool to see their funky Thanksgiving ice cream menu full of interesting flavors. 

I'm more of a boring ice cream / classic lover so just went with the vanilla bean which was great. But, it was still cool to see interesting, innovative flavors to try out.
author: Leina K.

description: One of my favorite ice cream spots in SF! If the unique flavors don't lure you in, then the aroma of fresh baked waffle cones definitely will. They always have a great selection of flavors and also have a wonderful seasonal selection with local ingredients. The almond brittle is my fave!
author: Liza H.

description: Not a big fan of their ice creams personally but the service is always great. Very patient and very helpful even when the gf requested 4 tastings. You might like their ice cream if you dont like sweet flavors.
author: Manjil S.

description:
It was okay. Have no idea why all those ppl were willing to wait for 30 mins for flavorless ice cream. You feel the butter in your mouth after every spoon as a solid form which is not good. Too sweet. Way more sweet than an ice cream is supposed to be. 
Got the strawberry and tres leches, salted caramel, and orange blossom. Salted caramel was something other than ice cream cuz it was super salty, sweet and salt was not well balanced couldn't finish it. No tiene sabor!!
author: Zeynep D.

description: Great spin on ice cream texture and flavor. If you're traditional flavor ice cream type this might not be a place for you. I will say the sweet potato with maple ice cream was pretty good. The ice cream is creamy but not too rich. As a newly opened place its all hype so lines and wait time are long. I probably won't be waiting 40 minutes for ice cream again but hey, its San Francisco. The smart ones come in buy a $12 pint on head outside to enjoy. Tables and seating are limited. Some flavors are also limited.
author: Gerald H.

description:
The craze of premium ice creams is real. I am a poor victim of this craze for the past few years, but Salt & Straw now in Hayes Valley? It's dangerous. Coming here on a Saturday night after getting food and drinks can only mean delicious ice cream. 

ICE CREAM: Strawberry Tres Leches as the classic. Oh god. I had to get a pint to take home that I held from my Lyft ride back to East Bay. T'was worth the journey. The creaminess, the layers, and the strong strawberry jam in the ice cream were amazing. Also, got the seasonal Thanksgiving ones this time (Turkey flavor anybody?) that were pretty impressive this time. I am looking forward to trying out the December flavors, but the seasonal stuff keeps it all interesting for repeat customers. 

Thanks for bringing this over from Portland because we all know that San Francisco needs more ice cream options ;).
author: Albert H.

description: Salt and Straw is hands down my favorite ice cream in San Francisco. I know it's originally from Portland, but that doesn't mean it can't be the greatest ice cream in this city too. My go to flavor is the strawberry tres leches, which I got again this week, but I paired it with the June seasonal beet flavor with bleu cheese, which sounds weird, but tastes amazing. The service was great, and our server put up with me trying basically every flavor on their menu and some of them even twice because I was confused about the flavor. Go to salt and straw for a true ice cream eating experience, and I promise they will not disappoint you.
author: Sonia S.

description:
Portland, LA, SF....doesn't matter where you go for Salt & Straw, its always amazing.  Easily my favorite ice cream place. 

*Honey Lavender never gets old.
author: John H.

description:
I scream for ice cream!!!

Chocolate gooey brownie on a waffle cone! Yum!

I love how unique the flavors are! But some are so unique you only need on tasting spoonful of it lol
author: Jenny C.

description:
Love this place. Reminds me of the early days of Humphrey Slocombe before they became corporate style. There are so many unique flavors. Definitely not your vanilla ice cream place. 

Tons of flavors and the workers are so nice and friendly and are happy to let to try as many flavors as to want. I like that they know it's busy and they keep the flow going. They even let you start sampling while you're in line. I came here once when it wasn't too busy like when they first opened but even then there was a five person line. My first visit i got the lemon curd I think it was and it was very lemony and delicious. 

The second time my brother and I went when they had their Halloween flavors and that was really interesting. I got the vampire inspired ice cream which included I think it was either pork or ox blood. It was strange but still really good. I am a big fan or unique ice cream flavors. 

Not much space to sit and enjoy. There's one bench outside.
author: Denice D.

description: Absolutely loved the coconut jam and chocolate crispies!  Glad it was brought back again this year.  We drove all the way from Oakland for this.  Addicted!  May have to do it again before September is over.
author: Kelly M.

description: Best ice cream I've ever had! We went two days in a row during our visit to San Francisco. Tastes so fresh and homemade. The flavors are so brilliantly done and compliment each other so well. What a special treat.
author: Jessie A.

description:
Delicious high quality ice cream. Excellent addition to the neighborhood! 

I went there a couple of times already and enjoyed several of their flavors. You can try them out to help you choose and you can have half-scoops if you are still in doubt. 

Another interesting factor at this store is that they have special flavors (Halloween flavors, Thanksgiving flavors).

The smell from the ice cream cones is just irresistible. Walk far away from the sidewalk or you will be lured in.
author: Andréia S.

description:
Located in Hayes Valley, the area only has street metered parking which is really hard to find (so good luck!). Two benches outside and very little indoor seating, they are mainly geared for take-away. If you just want a pint, just grab from the mini freezer and pay (don't have to wait in the scooping line).

I love how they use local ingredients and aren't afraid to try unique combinations. I tried them 1st in Portland and very excited they now have 2 locations in SF. I think I've been to all their Portland and Los Angeles locations as well! And they aren't stingy with their sampling like many ice cream shops! You don't feel rushed and the employees are very helpful.

Warning: one scoop = size of tennis ball. If you can't eat that much but want 2 flavors, ask for a split scoop.

Sampled this trip:
Salt Honey Marshmallow was more salty than sweet. Loved the Sightglass Coffee & Dandelion Chocolate flavor (two of my favorite things together!). The Strawberry Tres Leches was overly sweet to me.

Now the Halloween flavors. My favorite was the Dracula's Blood Pudding (which does contains pigs blood) but one person I think best described it as a spiced hot cocoa flavor. The Great Candycopia was extremely sweet  (as expected) but I like the different textures. Creepy Crawly Critters does have chocolate covered insects (which you can buy a bag of in their store) that kinda reminded me of small chocolate covered rice crispies. The Freckle Hyde Potion is slightly bitter since it does have bittermelon. The Essence of Ghost was a fairly light sorbet.

My usual go-to flavor is the honey lavender if you want a safer flavor choice.

Oh and the waffle cones DO taste as good as they smell, so I HIGHLY recommend it!
author: Kitty K.

description:
Hands down my favorite ice cream spot in the city!! Honey Lavender, Olive Oil + Lemon Custard, and Peach Vinegar Cobbler with Toasted Nutmeg are my personal favorites. Highly recommend! They always have very out of the box seasonal flavors but I haven't been able to stray away from my three favorites yet.. Can't wait to try them though!

Employees here are super efficient and nice. They always give very generous samples. There's typically a line but it moves fairly quickly. Plus you can always skip the line by buying a pint and going straight to the cash register :)
author: Mandy H.

description:
Salt & Straw Hayes Valley is opening really soon! I love that they source locally and make their ingredients in-house, stuff like the almond brittle. They have 5 seasonal Halloween-themed flavors that are worth a try. The creep crawly one is green tea with bugs in it :P I really liked the Freckle & Hyde one that's slightly bitter and has chunks that contain Pop Rocks! 

The location is convenient if you're eating lunch/dinner nearby. Hayes is lined with restaurants! I found parking around the corner in front of some homes.
author: Katherine S.

description:
Came here on a crowded night, but the line moved quickly.

It was my first time coming and there were so many interesting flavors on the menu, but oh my god Dylan offered the besttttttttttttt service I've ever had at an ice cream shop or even anywhere. He was very knowledgeable on all the flavors and recommendations, super nice and patient with our group. 

I like how they have a standard menu and a limited edition menu and both are pretty wide with many options. The duck fat ice cream was so good and i've never thought i'd ever say something like that in my life. The strawberry tres leches and honey lavender were really yummy too.

Can't wait to come and try the next round of new limited edition menu.
author: Jennifer C.

description: My son and I got ice cream from this location today.  We've been to a couple other locations.  As usual, the ice cream was delicious.  I got the new seasonal flavor called Candycopia.  If was basically all my favorite Halloween chocolate bars on a cone.  The best part of the experience was actually being helped by Lima.  She was exceptionally nice and super helpful in helping us pick out our flavors.  Looking forward to the next time.
author: Jeannine M.

description: The salted caramel flavour was the perfect mixture of sweet and salty, and it tasted delicious with the waffle cone. I also loved the texture of the ice cream-- such creamy perfection.  This is another one of those SF spots you almost always have to wait a while in line for, but it's well worth the wait!
author: Charmaine L.

description: Wow.  The ice cream is so good!  The roasted strawberry has plenty of strawberries and the cookie monster has nice chunks of cookie in it.  The sea salt caramel was also delicious.  I'd highly recommend this place to everyone - it is the best ice cream I've had (I dare to say it's better than Mitchell's!).
author: Chris L.

description:
Far more interesting and exciting ice cream venue than your average fare. Some flavors on the menu that I'll likely never try - though I'm sure they're right up someone's alley - but I love the locally sourced ice cream flavors and the combinations that you're not going to see elsewhere. 

Sight glass coffee and single origin dandelion chocolate for the win.
author: William O.

description: Ice cream! you scream! we all scream!.. for Salt and Straw Ice Cream! The flavors are all home made, creamy, and so unique in their own ways! Truly a delectable treat after exploring the best of what the city has to offer. The only reason why I knocked a star off is because when they were taking orders from people in line, we were skipped for some odd reason.(maybe the worker thought the group ahead of us were in the same party?) She didn't ask if we were in the same party and she just assumed. It is truly nothing more than a trivial matter of communication. I won't press any further on this as the rest of the service was amazing and the ice cream always has me coming back for some more! I definitely recommend their chocolate brownie flavor to satisfy your chocolate craving as this is my go to!
author: Bernard W.

description: The lines can be crazy, but they move fairly quickly. Tried a crazy flavor, fennel ice cream and it was awesome. Never expected it to taste this good
author: Kirsten F.

description:
Finally made it to the store. This one is on Hayes, near Laguna. Tough area to find parking, but it was my lucky day, a car just pulled out and I got the spot. 
It was not crowded, and we had time to browse around. I was interested in the chefs collabs for June, and that's where it was so hard to decide! They all sounded weirdly fabulous!! 
Being a fan of Traci Des Jardins, I asked for a taste of the duck fat and cherry ice cream. Yeah, I was hesitant when I heard duck fat. But after the tasting, I was HOOKED!! And my son had the Tokyo PB and J, it was awesome too!! 
Guess we need to come back before the month of June is over and they will have new flavors. 
Salt and Straw, you are my favorite ice cream store!!
author: lovetoeat a.

description:
Delicious and unique ice cream!
I thought the line was a bit too long however for a scoop of ice cream
author: Herb Q.

description:
Give Joelle a raise! Girl is so friendly and provided great service, it made getting ice cream super fun (and by that I mean beyond the joy that comes with getting ice cream anytime). Thanks! 

(Oh, ice cream is delish, too.)
author: Rowena L.

description:
I'd been wanting to try Salt & Straw since I heard a location would be opening in SF, and was not disappointed. The store is tucked between a couple of boutiques and apartment buildings, but didn't feel absurdly busy like the rest of SF. Inside, there's mostly wood decor that gives it a very true-to-Oregon feel. 

The service was great and very fast- they let my friends and I try multiple flavors, and there are even adorable kid-level slots for you to dispense your used spoons in. I ended up ordering the strawberry tres leches- a popular seasonal flavor only offered in the SF location, and it did not disappoint. Usually, I'm not a fan of strawberry flavored things, but it did not have any hint of artificial strawberry and had a good balance of both strawberry and tres leches flavors. My friend ordered the olive oil ice cream and he loved it- all the flavors are really unique. It was my birthday, and they gave me my order for free, which was really nice!!
author: Kelly Y.

description: The single-split offering is such a great idea!  I tried the Sightglass Coffee Cashew Praline and Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches combo.  Smooth and creamy.  Just enough to get your sweet fix.  Waffle cone was destroyed!
author: John D.

description: Great ice cream & helpful staff. Classic and rotating flavors the staff let you try before deciding. The line was long but worth the wait.
author: Joe W.

description: Ice cream has been redefined for me after visiting this popular new joint in the city. They have an amazing selection of in-season flavors, which are a must-try. Who knew there would ever be an ice cream combining goat cream cheese, habanero and berries. And would still taste amazing!! I personally love the honey lavender which is very light on sugar. Must check out if you are in the area.
author: Nayan C.

description: I always visit Salt & Straw if there's one in town. After brunch decided to swing by since the weather was so perfect and actually quite warm! I noticed this location happened to be fairly new so we decided to stop by. Like all Salt & Straw there is always a line out the door but it moves fairly quickly. They had their October speciality items as well as their rotating flavors. I tried the olive oil with lemon custard and then the peach vinegar cobbler with the toasted nutmeg. The peach cobbler was a clear winner for me because it had the sour, sweet, crunch from the cobbler crumb and the spice. It was just perfect. This location is near several restaurants and shops so it worked out perfect!!
author: Jenny K.

description: I frequent this salt and straw often. It's always delicious. However, in this review, I'd like to highlight my "scooper", JOELLE!!! She has THE BEST personality of anyone who's ever helped me there before. (And I've probably had AT LEAST a dozen). My friend, who had never been, brought me for my birthday and she tased a solid ten flavors. Joelle didn't sigh or roll her eyes- she was super friendly and was making jokes with us- not putting on any pressure. Then, since it was my birthday, she even added two little extra baby scoops at the top of my cone for the two flavors I didn't end up choosing (but were runner up ). I cannot praise her personality enough- her smile was infectious. She even came around the bar to take a picture with me for my birthday!! Thank you Joelle! (Oh PS: please bring back the peach vinegar cobbler ASAP!)
author: Rachel R.

description:
I love ice cream. I also love Salt and Straw. My entire 10 minute experience here was accompanied by a smile. At first, I was drawn in by the sign outside listing all their ice cream flavors. They have many, ranging from the normal Sea Salt with Caramel Ribbons to more peculiar flavors such as Berkeley Olive Grove Olive Oil and Blave Olive Brittle & Goat Cheese. I went in to try their olive oil flavor, and as weird as it sounded I was not let down. The combination of olive oil with ice cream left me with a smooth and creamy taste, nowhere near the image of oily olive oil mixed with milk.
Even if you are looking for more normal flavors, I highly recommend this place. Staff were cheerful and friendly, and also very careful of allergies, as I myself have a nut allergy.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Staff were extremely friendly and let me try a lot of the flavors. They also made sure to ask if I had an allergy before tasting (which I do) so that was great. The staff were very knowledgeable when it came to what had gluten in etc. 

The quality of the ice cream itself was incredible and I loved that. Personally I was not a fan of the flavors. I found them too floraly but I know that's more a personal preference.
author: Abby B B.

description:
Quite possibly the best ice cream I've ever had! S&S blows Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, and others out of the water. Their flavors are some of the most unique I've ever come across and the flavors are vibrant and robust!

Today from their "Eat Your Vegetables" seasonal menu I tried Carrot Cake Batter & Pralined Hazelnuts, Melon & Capicola, Apricots & Fresh Thyme, and Green Fennel & Maple. Carrot cake was my favorite featuring a strong molasses taste. Next best was the Melon & Capicola - I've never had a meat in an ice cream! The Capicola flavor was light - just a hint but enough to make it special. The best part of the Apricot flavor was the apricots. The Green Fennel was good but I could see it at Bi-Rite. Not as unique.

I also had a scoop of the Mt Tam Cheese with Toasted Acme Bread - it was incredibly flavorful and unique! It is possibly the most unique ice cream I've ever had. The cheese flavor is very strong! Not my favorite overall but I love the uniqueness!

I also tasted their Breakaway Matcha & Black Raspberry and Organic Roots Arbequina Olive Oil. The Olive Oil was good but similar to the Green Fennel I could see it at Bi-Rite. The Matcha was great and is what I will be getting more of when I go back! The creamiest matcha ice cream I've ever had paired perfectly with a vigorous black raspberry jam! Think it would make a great shake.
author: J D.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place ever since I saw them on Shark Tank!! I knew I had to try their funky flavors and I finally did; it only took forever! 

At last, I was able to try the honey lavender (my all time favorite flavor) and salted caramel ice cream flavors. 

The honey lavender did not disappoint; I absolutely loved it! The sea salt was just okay for me; it was on the saltier side. However, definitely coming back to try the rest of their flavors and to get honey lavender again! 

Four stars for the great variety of ice cream flavors.
Four stars for the laid back Portland vibe.
Four stars for the awesome employees working here.

Will be back for more!
author: Jorgess M.

description:
This place is just fantastic. I went twice in the last three days. They have excellent customer service letting you try flavours to your hearts desire. The serving size is exactly what it should be for ice cream (one scoop won't let you down and 2 feels like YAY I'M REALLY GETTING ICE CREAM!)

There were a number of excellent flavours. I has the almond brittle salted ganache one twice. The chocolate gooey brownie one once and the salted malted chocolate chip cookie dough once. I also thought the freckles chocolate one and wild honey ricotta and Berkeley olive oil ones were all contenders. Seriously - it doesn't get more difficult to choose!
author: Sydney W.

description: Their portion is huge. Their double ice-cream is almost like triple icecream in New York City. Recommend to go!
author: Big B.

description:
Honey lavender is my favorite. Wow...it is yummy beyond yummy.  

The place is well appointed with a few chairs and modern design (Glass/steel).  Great location (on the 21 Hayes Line), the quality of the product is  well worth the hand crafted cost.     Love the flavors and herbal elements of the ice cream.

SAMPLE 1st:  For those of you who would like to taste the ice cream before purchasing, just ask them.  They give you a small spoon and you can taste several flavors before you buy it.  I was glad they offered it, because I would have messed up if I had bought the Vegan ginger ice cream w/o tasting it.  I did not like the Ginger Vegan, so I am glad with the Honey lavender.
author: Vanilla C.

description: Jada provided the best customer service. She was very attentive and sincere to which recommendations she made. The environment was very fun and friendly the workers created a great atmosphere. Of course salt and straw ice cream is the best so my order was delicious! The waffle cone with two scoops is what I ordered. I cannot wait to visit again! Thanks Jada and Salt and Straw! Your my favorite
author: Amanda D.

description: I may be lactose intolerant but that won't stop me from enjoying my favorite at Salt & Straw. Honey Lavender mmmmmmmmm...
author: Rosa F.

description: Does this even need another 5 star review? Salt and Straw is what made a non-ice cream lover into an ice cream craving fiend so beware! I love all of their flavors, loving tasting the weird ones- nacho ice cream? But always go back to my two classic flavors, Salted With caramel swirls and gooey brownie. They make their brownies with marshmallows to keep a texture so soft and perfect when frozen. Always upgrade to a waffle cone!
author: Piper W.

description: Went their on a Sunday after our lunch. The place was super duper busy. The line was really long - about 20 people ahead of us, took about 15 mins to get to the counter. The flavors are fun, we ordered a tasting platter - the honey lavender was the best.
author: A. D.

description: Great place and ambience and various kinds of ice cream  they are mostly very sweet though! Had a classic coffee and they have it blended with chocolate and caramel. Sweet!
author: Moorissa T.

description: Fantastic ice cream! The line can get long, but it's well worth the wait. I love their unique flavors (especially the sea salt w/caramel ribbons) and the staff is friendly! Don't be shy about asking to try different flavors!
author: Helen F.

description: So happy Salt & Straw is so close to where I live. I've tried a couple of their specialty flavors and they were all good. Very sweet rich, so if you don't have a heavy sweet tooth, definitely consider sharing or getting a small!
author: Lillian B.

description: The wait is usually pretty long but so worth waiting for. This is my favorite spot to get ice cream in San Francisco. There is a flavor here for everyone.
author: Melissa V.

description:
A long overdue review. I've tried this place when it first opened in SF. Frankly, I think this place is over hyped. I was excited to try it because all the people I knew that tried it in Portland, loved it. Of course, I was thrilled that they were opening up in SF. 

The line was out the door which was probably a good sign. They had the menu outside as to what was served. After looking it over, there wasn't much I'd go out of my reach for. A lot of people recommended the honey lavender - but I personally don't really care for honey or lavender let alone the combination itself. As I got to the counter, I asked to sample a few (honey lavender, lemon flavor and sea salt with caramel ribbons). I'm sure my facial expressions gave it away that I didn't like any of them. Since I asked to try a few, I didn't want to look like I was mooching off samples, I got the lemon flavor anyway. 

I can honestly say, it has been almost a year since I've first tried the ice cream here and I haven't been back since. Maybe I'll change my mind one of these days.
author: Ruthie T.

description:
I love ice cream with a passion I can barely begin to describe. 

Came on a Saturday night and waited for less than 10 minutes. They have a lot of very unique flavors; I wanted to try the Sightglass Coffee, but they were out due to an order mixup. I got the Peppermint Hot Chocolate and Double Fold Vanilla instead. The Hot Chocolate was alright, a bit grainy and sweet (think hot chocolate powder). The Vanilla was a m a z i n g. Hands down the best vanilla ice cream I've ever tasted. Creaminess wasn't quite as good as McConnell's in Santa Barbara, but still very high. 

tl;dr: I'm dying to come back again and I still think about the Double Fold Vanilla sometimes.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Ah, relentless capitalism. Ice-cream based consumer surplus in SF is very high right now. Here is a brief history of ice cream in SF:

Prehistoric era: Mitchell's. Fatty, delicious. Baskin & Robbins, you're dead to me.

Aughts: Bi-Rite. Salt? And Caramel? dafuq? oh, i get it.

Late Aughts: Humphrey Slocombe - SF's hottest ice cream club. It had everything: huge lines, weird flavors, booze in their ice cream, and a weird twitter feud with its own parody account. Peak millenial/recession/hipster. Was always playing mean jokes on their clientele- I ordered "Pepper Mint" here once and didn't notice the space: cracked black pepper and mint ice cream. FU, HS

Early 10s: Smitten. A Stanford business school grad decides she wants to make weird ice cream machines. Her parents wonder what they could have done with that $200k they shelled out for her MBA. Thanks, Smitten Girl's parents, all that money resulted in delicious af ice cream.

There were a couple also-rans along the way - Mr/s miscellaneous, CREAM, that place in cole valley with a generic name that escapes me. But these were not the bleeding edge of ice creams.

And finally, SF succumbs to a foreign invader: Salt and Straw. Luscious and thick like old school Mitchells, wonderful high end flavors like smitten. Sufficiently novel flavors to surprise and delight, but not so weird that it's off-putting (ARE YOU LISTENING, HUMPHREY SLOCOMBE??). It's like all the former ruling SF ice cream shops had a wierd multi-parent baby and it only inherited their best attributes. Of course it's from Portland.
author: Anthony L.

description:
The employees are the sweetest, coolest human beings. The line usually isn't bad at all. And those seasonal flavors are heavenly. 

My recent favorites are the salted chocolate chip cookie dough, gingerbread dough, and surprisingly grapefruit eggnog. 

Honestly we don't deserve you, S&S.
author: Leah F.

description: While I am generally against waiting in line, Salt and Straw is worth every second. Xander was our ice cream Spirit Guide, he led us through the flavors with skill and finesse. Recommended: Goat Cheese, Happy Birthday Elvis, Olive oil. Yum!
author: Mimosa A.

description: What a waffle !!! and their creamy ice cream with amazing flavors is making husband stay in long lines here in San Francisco and in Los Angeles if he could he will be going there twice a day it's not too sweet or boring flavors I love their honey sticks two thumbs up
author: carla a.

description:
Happened to be in the neighborhood just wandering around when we stumbled across Salt & Straw, which is based in Portland.  I didn't realized that this was a "newer" location that recently opened because I couldn't remember where their SF location was (after looking it up, it's at Fillmore & Sacramento) that had opened several months ago.  So they have more than one location in SF now!  Never mind that it's the first day it's felt like fall to me this year, I'll still have ice cream!  The line wasn't bad...service was really friendly, & I got to try several flavors before I decided.  I ended up getting Sightglass Coffee & Single Origin Dandelion Chocolate (yup, they locally source their ingredients) and Honey Lavender (which could've also been Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches,Olive Oil & Lemon Custard, & I had a hard time deciding).  I decided to split my "single" size serving into 2 flavors--yes, there is a charge for that.  I debated getting a waffle cone, but eventually decided on a cup.  Yummm!!!  We were lucky enough to snag some of the limited seating inside to enjoy our ice cream (my friend was dressed more for summer weather, so was happy that we got seating inside).  So, I had a great experience at my first visit at a Salt & Straw outside of Portland.  Now I don't have to travel to Portland to visit Salt & Straw, & I even have 2 locations to choose from in SF!  

Oh yeah, they had special Halloween themed flavors for October, but I didn't try any of them. 
 
Located on the north side of Hayes just east of Laguna.
author: Linda T.

description:
First time trying ice cream from Salt and Straw, decided to split a flight with a friend. A flight is only $11 bucks, which is pretty reasonable when you split it between two people and you get to try 4 flavors! I chose Roasted Strawberry Tres Leche and Chocolate Gooey Brownie while my friend chose NeoCocoa's Black Sesame Brittle and Brown Sugar and Sea Salt with Caramel Ribbons. 
I think the Sesame brittle is definitely an acquired taste, I wasn't a huge fan of it but my friend liked it since she liked sesame flavor. The Sea Salt was a little too salty for me but I liked it better than the sesame.
I originally liked the Strawberry Tres Leche one the best, until I got to the bottom and saw that it had pieces of cake in there, which actually detracted from the overall dessert. I loved the ice cream portion though. The Chocolate gooey brownie was just a classic and I loved it overall the most because it was exactly what you think it to be. I'd definitely like to try new flavors in the future!! 
Service was nice and friendly and the looking of the place was pretty chic, I just wish there had been more seating available.
author: Payal P.

description: Me and my kids love salt & straw! I have an actual wheat allergy and willingly suffer for their roasted strawberry tres leche ice cream. So Benedryl in hand I enjoy their delicious flavors, especially their rotating holiday flavors. The lines are always long but that's because each customer is patiently allowed to try a sample of each and every flavor they want to try without being rushed or given attitude. The staff at each location is always happy, friendly, informative and if you have other allergies they ask to make sure you don't die. Always a plus with good customer service. I usually try a ice cream flight when there's a bunch of flavors to try which is $11 but sooooo worth it. If you're an ice cream person this is a must try and currently all the locations are in San Francisco hopefully they'll put more along the peninsula !! Hint hint! There's more parking out there hehe
author: Sheryl G.

description: Salt & Straw, always a welcome addition for the foodie ice cream crowd in San Francisco. Quality is the same as the store in Fillmore, but this one is definitely on the smaller side, which is no surprise because that's the sort of scene in Hayes Valley. I would say for now, the staff is struggling with handling the large crowd at a speedy rate, but that just might take some time to sort out. Flavors here are always eccentric, playfully paired yet delicious. The ice cream is creamy and has a smooth texture, that is iconic of Salt & Straw. Overall, definitely worth a visit if you're craving something sweet and icy cold!
author: Jenny Z.

description: Can I get an Amen up in here? Salt & Straw is by far the best ice cream that has ever existed in the history of anything. They get an A+ from me for three reasons. First, their flavors are unique and always stellar (even the ones on the weirder end of the spectrum). Second, they take the time to make sure your experience in the line is worth the wait. They are patient with each of their customers in helping them decide exactly which flavors work best for them. Third, they regularly switch out their flavors and always have several pint options in case you'd like to skip the line and head straight for the spoons. I love this place and highly recommend you giving it a taste!
author: Joe G.

description: One of my new favorite ice cream places! Whenever I go it's always super busy, but that doesn't take away from their friendly customer service. There's new seasonal flavors every month, so it's fun coming in and trying all of them. Luckily they have pints of the seasonal flavors, so in case you miss out on getting individual scoops you can take home a whole pint ~ They also have a classic menu that's there all year round. I love the olive oil and strawberry tres leche
author: Gloria C.

description:
I was very excited only to be very disappointed. Everything lacked flavor and almost had a freezer burn blandness to it. Took 2 bites of the brownie sundae and threw it away. Salty brownie that tasted burned with salty ice cream. It was a waste of money. The strawberry tres leches was good but not the leches cake portion. The waffle cone was the best thing I tasted here. Let me tell you. I looooove Ice cream, especially brownie sundaes, just not this one. It was seriously gross. 

If you want amazing ice cream... go to smitten.
author: Autumn C.

description:
Bangin roasted strawberry with tres leches.

We had a flight with:
Roasted strawberry with tres leches
Double fold vanilla
Chocolate potato chip
Sightglass coffee

All really nice flavors with the strawberry being my top flavor- just real strawberry with little cake bites. I wasn't too fond of the cake bits, but I really could care less.

The vanilla was OK- dissapointing considering it's my favorite flavor.

I'd be back to try their other unique flavors.
author: Raymond L.

description: Salt and Straw is open today! I tried a few of their October flavors, which are Halloween themed. They're the same ones as in Portland's Hawthorne location, which I went to earlier this month. The candycopia flavor is especially sweet because of the butterscotch flavor, but it does use housemade chocolate candies like their version of the whopper. I also tried the essence of ghost, which had a faint scotch aftertaste. This month, they also have a creepy crawly flavor which is a matcha green tea ice cream with crickets and mealworms. Because the ice cream is so sweet, it wasn't so bad, but the bugs are definitely noticeable after the ice cream melts away in your mouth and you still have crunchy bits stuck in your teeth... In the end, I opted for some classic flavors like the coffee & choco (San Francisco's Sightglass & Dandelion instead of Stumptown & Woodblock) and honey lavender. Great taste as always, and a little melty. Lovely staff.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I've had Salt & Straw in Portland before, but never in California. I was a bit disappointed in the flavors offered because Portland had such unique and interesting mix of flavors. I remember trying oxtail in Portland! The flavors at this location were typical. Nothing too crazy besides the olive oil one. 

The flight is such a great deal! 4 flavors for $11. I shared it with my date and we couldn't finish it. They also let you try as many flavors as you want too. January was vegan month, so they had a handful of limited edition vegan flavors. All the flavors I tried were super flavorful and taste exactly like the description 

Location- It was surprisingly not too crowded, but we still struggled trying to find a place to sit and enjoy our flight. We settled and posted up against the wall where the merchandise was. Wish the place was bigger with more seating!
author: Annie N.

description: Out of this world ice cream flavors, decadent and have the most creative seasonal flavors! We recently checked our the Thanksgiving flavors and they were to die for!!! I highly recommend the sweet potato casserole flavor - wow! Not to mention their staff members are so nice and fun to talk to during the sampling process. This is how ice cream should be
author: Priya S.

description: While the wait is always long, it's because you are able to try and sample as many flavors as you want, which is always fun! Staff were attentive and helpful. Ice cream was delicious! Can't go wrong with the sea-salt and caramel :)
author: Ian V.

description: The BEST ice cream. Period. I was in San Fran for 4 days and went 3 times during my stay there. The flavors are super creative and delicious! I never would have thought I would like vegan ice cream but I loved it. They let you try as many flavors has you like before you make your order and the service is extremely accommodating and friendly. I highly recommend one of their homemade cones as well. The flavors I had in my three trips were the Vegan Peanut Butter Cookie Dough, Vegan Mint Whoopie Pie, Gooey Chocolate Brownie, S'mores, Avocado Oaxacan Fudge and the Salted Malted Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough. My favorite flavor is the Chocolate Gooey Brownie but everything is amazing. I dream of going back to the West Coast to have this ice cream. It is THE BEST.
author: Carissa V.

description: Favorite place for classic flavors with a slight twist. They use real ingredients in their ice cream and not just flavoring. Had the strawberry and it came with real strawberries and cheesecake. The samples are big, they make an effort to get a bit of everything on to the spoon.
author: Diane Z.

description: Great ice cream break in San Francisco. we stopped here at the Salt and Straw. I had the Almond Brittle with salted ganache and the waffle cone. The servers gave us plenty of samples especially the Thanksgiving ice cream.
author: Scott B.

description: One of the best ice cream stores in San Francisco. They have so many good and interesting flavors and it never disappoint. I will say the service is a little disorganized- there is always a long line but it doesn't flow well. You never know who is in line and they sometimes serve people out of order. Definitely check it out but not if you are in a hurry :)
author: Carol Ann V.

description: Ah, ice cream. If I have a favorite food, we all know it is pizza, but ice cream is a very close second. If it was acceptable to eat ice cream as a meal, then it would take the top spot. I feel like an ice cream connoisseur of sorts because I eat so much of it and even make my own at home. I'm a sucker for high quality, rich and creamy, decadent ice cream - and this did not disappoint. I've heard the hype and always wanted to try Salt & Straw so I was thrilled to get the opportunity last night. To my surprise there was no line so I was served immediately (I did create a line though because I wad holding things up by sampling - sorry!). I initially tried the pumpkin goat cheese which tasted like cheesecake, and then sampled the coffee and knew I needed an entire cone of just that. It was delicious. Perfect texture, amazing flavor, very interesting (in a good way) and just perfect. The cone was the icing on the cake because it was fresh and the flavor was on point. What else can I say? It lives up to the hype and although pricey, the portion size was crazy (again, in a good way).
author: Ashley F.

description: Came here after Al Mano. This place is over hyped and I didn't like the ice cream at all. I tried different flavors and went with the strawberry one to be safe, but it felt really heavy. To be fair I don't think I am into the type of mixed flavors. The staff was really nice and it's just me that can't appreciate unique ice cream like this.
author: Karen H.

description: High quality ice cream with unusual flavors that sometimes work for me and sometimes don't. They definitely have something for everyone. Hip af. Always a long line but it moves pretty quickly. Not a place to take kids or impatient people. If you are in a hurry you can skip the line and grab a pint to go.
author: Brian J.

description: Salt and Straw is an ice cream shop that offers a a wide variety of very fun and exotic flavors that you simply cannot find anywhere else. There Ice cream was superb with a creamy/ salty taste mixing together to create a sweet and savory experience. Staff was very nice, and I liked the aesthetic. 5/5 would reccomend.
author: Felipe Q.

description: Ice cream with local ingredients. Even though this company started in Portland, every location has flavors specific to their area made with local ingredients and also seasonal flavors developed by local chefs. They also sell the actual products that they use to make their ice cream in the store. I think this is a really fun business model! I had the Almond brittle with chocolate ganache and my husband had the Malted vanilla with chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream. Both were amazing! I look forward to trying more flavors whenever I get a chance to return.
author: Rebbi B.

description: I can't even walk by this place anymore without stopping to get something. The amazing smells pull you in from the street. My favorite is to get a split scoop in a waffle cone, after I try a few new flavors. So good, every time.
author: Ange R.

description:
This place is life. And 100% worth checking out even if you've been to the other locations!! They have localized flavors using ingredients native to the area (ie. a Sightglass coffee flavor for SF) which you won't want to miss.

Also great for both adventurous and traditional ice cream-lovers alike! Options range from chocolate/brownie types to the more interesting dark-chocolate-covered-crickets Halloween flavor they had this year. You'll truly never tire of Salt & Straw because their flavors constantly rotate. If anything, you'll be hard-pressed to make sure you get a chance to sample each season's new menu items! As someone who literally subsists off of ice cream (yes unhealthy, I'm aware) I haven't even made my way over often enough to catch all of the changing flavors!

Finally, I personally prefer the Hayes Valley shop to the Fillmore just because it's a nice walk afterwards and much more accessible via public transport. Do yourself a favor and make trip to Salt & Straw asap!
author: Junes S.

description: Hands down the best ice cream around. So glad they finally came into California. Recommend trying the ice cream flight because its so hard to just choose one flavor to eat
author: Joshua E.

description: I can't believe one of my favorite ice cream shops has just opened in my neighborhood!! Welcome to Hayes Valley S&S! Long live peach cobbler balsamic
author: Terry N.

description:
Super happy that they have Salt & Straw in the Bay now (I'm from LA and miss visiting these options when I'm not in my hometown). I actually came here on back to back days, and I haven't found the wait to be too awful - particularly because I kind of anticipate it.

I came right before Thanksgiving, and their special flavors were quite interesting. I think a tasty standout was the goat cheese and pumpkin pie one (I could be mixing up some flavors there, but whatever I tried was good enough).

The first night I actually opted with a banana flavored one. It was explained to me that they actually get the bread bits for this ice cream from local bakeries from day-old bread so it's not wasted. Not sure if it was just me, but some bites actually had the texture of stale-ish bread. As in the bread tasted a little bit hard and not so good, but the rest of the ice cream was pleasant.

Opted for the honey lavender the second day which was fantastic! I'd always recommend this place!
author: Daniel H.

description:
I completely understand why people go bonkers over Salt and Straw. "It's just ice cream" you say? No, sorry. You're wrong. It's like Frankenstein ice cream!! Their seasonal flavors were just absolutely out of left field and very ballsy but that's not a bad thing! During thanksgiving they had things like persimmon and walnut stuffing and buttered mash and gravey mash. But on a daily, they have delicious flavors like my favorites, banana bread, peach cobbler and strawberry tres leches. 
Overall, i've got to give it to salt and straw for coming out with some bold flavors. It will definitely keep me coming back. 
Oh they also have to-go pints/quarts so if you've fallen in love with a flavor, you can take it home!
author: Sarah N.

description: AMAZING ICE CREAM. Obsessed with the chocolate brownie, the honey lavender and the sea salt with caramel ribbons. The thanksgiving stuff is very weird I don't recommend but the regular flavors are amazing. The service staff at the other ones is better but it is good overall.
author: Jazlyn H.

description: Every time I go, I find myself wanting to try every flavor. I love this ice cream. Their seasonal flavors are outstanding. The staff is always friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, and nice.the line is usually long, but it's worth it!
author: Kaela O.

description: Very good! Overhyped a little, but mostly the line is worth the wait. I recommend the olive oil flavor most, and definitely get a waffle cone!
author: Elly L.

description:
I loooooove this place. 
Employees were so friendly and fun to converse with. They also let me take my time and try every flavor (which I honestly had to do because they're so unique/original and sadly I don't live in the city). And it was best ice cream I've ever had... I could just tell this place is high quality.
