I was super full from brunch but I still enjoyed finished my scoop and waffle cone like it was nothin' (that's when you know)
author: Tiff N.

description: Couldn't be more ecstatic that a salt and straw has opened in my neighborhood! I've been to two of their Portland locations and the one on fillimore and this outpost certainly lives up to all standards. If you haven't been here before I highly suggest getting the tasting flight - it's 4 huge scoops of ice cream for $11 - a great way for 2 or 3 people to try a bunch of different things. The lines are long but trust me when I say it's worth it (below 30 mins only). Their waffle cones are excellent too!
author: Sam M.

description: We stumbled upon this gem leaving dinner one night and couldn't believe the line out the door for ice cream! It was freezing out and people were itching to get ice cream from this place! So we joined the line and waited for some scrumptious ice cream that you won't be disappointed in. I ordered two flavors in one waffle cone, chocolate brownie and a salted almond flavor. The waffle cone BLEW me away. It was incredible, and makes the place smell like cake and heaven. The ice cream, however, was slightly more disappointing. It is DELICIOUS, definitely worth the price but it was a little too salty for me... I understand the store's name contributes to the salt, but slightly overdone for my liking.   But still totally worth it for the waffle cone!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
My first time here was absolutely fantastic. It was in the winter of 2017. The service was cheery and very generous in their ice cream amount. 

However, when I came this time on Thursday 6/7/18, the lady who was dark-skinned, short, and had glasses, was rather stingy with our amount of ice cream. Therefore making my $5 scoop totally not worth it. I would have settled for some store bought ice cream instead. 

Salt and Straw, if you are reading this, please have your employees know that a little bit more ice cream and love can give even bigger business down the road.
author: Katherine W.

description: Amazing ice cream, super friendly and helpful ice cream baristas. Worth the short wait. The flavors change regularly and do try something out of the ordinary, it is worth it.
author: Victoria N.

description: The line was pretty long at 10 pm but it moved quickly. I split a single scoop, which seemed like two normal sized scoops elsewhere. The peach cobbler was intense. The roasted strawberry had a great concentrated strawberry flavor. It was my favorite of the two.
author: Huey N.

description: Best ice cream in SF! Always interesting flavors but classic salted caramel is the favorite.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Solid ice cream! All the flavor I tried were good. I ended up getting the tres leches cake with strawberry sauce and chestnut. I
Wish the strawberry sauce was a bit more complex, but it was still good! I wish we had one closer to where I live so I could try more flavors! And anything with stumptown coffee is much appreciated!
author: Karen L.

description: If you are looking for the best salted caramel ice cream, this is the place! Staff are great. Lines can be long but it's worth a wait.
author: John G.

description: I ordered a pint via postmates. I had seasalt& caramel ribbon. It was nice as its fame tells you.
author: Jane K.

description: This is an ice cream experience like no other. They have a rotating monthly menu of unique flavors as well as an impressive year round menu. You can try every flavor they have and we nearly did! Super delicious ice cream, it was hard to make a choice  .
author: Tim F.

description: The ice cream  game in San Francisco is strong. You've got OG native shop like Bi-Rite and Mitchell's on your back, but Salt & Straw does not disappoint as a new comer. The waffle cone is huge and they got many special flavors. A must try when you strolling Hayes Valley.
author: Wayne Z.

description:
My absolute favorite ice cream place in San Francisco. Salt & Straw could give Bi-rite a run for its money any day. The flavor selection is incredible, staff are friendly and helpful, and ice cream is top quality. There are big pieces of brownie and generous portions of high quality ingredients in every bite. Even the waffle cones are perfectly crispy and fresh. 

If you're here in December try the Apple Brandy & Pecan Pie, otherwise you can't really go wrong with any of the flavors. Definitely lives up to the hype!!
author: Kath H.

description: over priced regular ice cream. Too much hype to justify the price tag and the wait . Much better options around
author: P S.

description: My husband is in love with the roasted strawberry tres leches and I'm pretty sure their rose petal and lavender is made from the laughter of the Disney princesses. I am a fan!
author: Juliet P.

description:
$5 for a scoop of artisanal creative ice cream, $1.25 extra for a fresh waffle cone.
Line out the door at 10pm took 20 mins to get the goods.
They do have pints for $11 
Kinda annoyed how they gave a ton of samples when the line and wait is crazy. 
They have menus out side and inside.
Tonight they were donating a portion of sales to local charities which is kind. 
They have 10 classic flavors and 5 or more monthly flavors. 
They source local ingredients and the scoop size is decent.
I work in the neighborhood so will be back! The strawberry treas Leche and chocolate brownie were perfect!
author: Amy W.

description: This ice cream is ridiculously good. I sampled a few as everyone should! I ended up narrowing it down to just 1 flavor as I only wanted a little bit but you can get a split cup or cone which is probably the best way to go. They make their waffle cones in Boise in front of your too. Pretty cool!  The honey lavender was the flavor I ended up with and it's really good. At least sample it. Hayes valley is a cool spot to hang out anyway, just find parking way in advance or park far away and Uber. Very popular area on weekends.
author: Luke S.

description: First, they serve the customers behind us before us, then the gentleman in the beenie kept getting me and friend's sample order mixed up. My last STRAW was finding a hair in my Chocolate Gooey Browney. My friends double folded vanilla still had big chunks of ice in it. My first and last time to this location...very disappointed.
author: Jacqueline Z.

description: Roasted strawberry tres leches is a gift from God we don't deserve and I am dreaming about the day I can taste it again. Swirls of softened strawberries, chunks of creamy tres leches... I'm in love
author: Gloria P.

description:
Alright, I don't often Yelp anymore, but I decided to do one for S&S considering how much ice cream I buy here. I'm from the South Bay and make a monthly, sometimes twice a month, trip to visit my friend and we go to Salt & Straw. I used to buy at the location on Fillmore, but have since started buying at this location because it doesn't feel as crowded. Anyway, back to the ice cream, I've definitely spent hundreds of dollars buying pints here ($11 each). I make it a habit of bringing my freezer bag (though one time I forgot it and bought a Salt & Straw bag), and stocking up for the month. Each month they roll out five new monthly flavors and I am obligated to buy a pint each time and see if I like it. That comes out to $55 at least, not including the SF exclusive flavors that they have. 

Be warned, not all the flavors are winners, but I'm sure they tested and tasted each flavor and it appealed to enough people to warrant being in their freezers. For instance, in January their monthly flavors were all vegan ice creams. Not my cup of tea, but there are people out there looking for quality vegan ice cream. Also, where else can you find a place bold enough to make grass flavored ice cream with bugs in it or ice cream with salted turkey skin brittle? When they do get the flavors right though, it's a homerun, touchdown, three-pointer (and one), and a one-timer all-in-one. A great example of this is The Great Candycopia, one of their October flavors. They diced up homemade candy bars and mixed it into salted butterscotch ice cream. That flavor was so good I bought three pints of it. Their everyday flavors are fantastic too, and I highly suggest you try their Almond Brittle with Salted Ganache & their Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches. Sometimes they'll have new flavors without announcing them, like this Goat Cheese with Black Olive Brittle flavor that was delicious. Unfortunately, they did not have any pints available, only scoops. 

Outside of the ice cream, every time I've gone to this location or the Fillmore St. location, the employees have been extremely friendly and accommodating. If there's a line, but you've got the time, it's worth it to wait and taste the different flavors. You can taste as many as you want before making your final decision. The employees also have great input when it comes to the flavors, so feel free to ask them what their favorites are. If you're only buying pints, you can skip the line, grab your pints from the freezer, and head to the cashier. 

Overall, great place with great people and ice cream flavors you won't find anywhere else.
author: Stephen N.

description: cute little shop on the corner.  very sweet staff and they do check if you have any allergies before letting you try any samples.  nice selection of flavors that you don't normally see. very delicious.
author: Ny P.

description: I'm not a big ice cream person but this place is a must once a month for me. The line is long on weekends and doesn't move very fast. I love that they let you try so many different samples. Side note, there are a few selected prepackaged ice cream tubs you can walk in and buy without waiting in line!
author: Pa H.

description: Really good- really expensive. $11 a pint is simply too much. Good for a date night or special occasion
author: Rex L.

description: OH DEAR GOD! Quite possibly the best ice cream I've ever had. Happy Birthday Elvis is a spiritual experience and it's vegan. You read that right. I'm not vegan but I had to try and it's ridiculously delicious. Such unique flavors and wonderful textures. If you're an ice cream connoisseur you have to go!
author: Beth A.

description:
This is by far one of the greatest Ice Cream shops I have ever been to in the Bay Area! Not only is the ice cream great and extremely rich, but everything about the company, the space/set up and the employees just left such a great impression me and will to you too! Seriously, the space is a little on the smaller side but it works perfectly. And the circuit they create is a very effective way of getting in and getting out with your ice cream in the smoothest way possible! Even the location of the shop is in a nice neighborhood with the park right next to the shop so you could do what I did which is get your ice cream and go to the park to enjoy it!

And can we talk about the workers? Salt & Straw does a tremendous job in taking the time to really train their workers in exactly what makes their ice cream and their company stand above the rest. This very helpful women named Jaden helped me decide on what ice cream I could get by letting me know about how Salt & Straw gives unlimited samples. Usually with places that give samples, I feel nervous about asking for too many samples because I don't want to take up too much time in line and I don't want to be an annoying/picky customer but Jaden reassured me that not only did the company care about a good customer experience, but so did she! She asked me if I wanted to try any flavors and with every flavor I tried, Jaden told me a fact about the flavor like how they make each flavor with actual local ingredients, how the ice cream is 17% butter fat (I think that's what she said) and even how they even support local business! Ultimately I went with the Birthday Cake flavor because that was the seasonal choice (Always try the seasonal flavors! The permanent menu is gonna be there but the seasonal flavors are a little more special in my eyes!) but am definitely coming back to try the Strawberry Tres Leches flavor! The atmosphere that the workers gave off is such a productive one and seeing all the employees smile and laugh between one another even made me smile! Keep up the INCREDIBLE management & service!
author: Kobe A.

description: Easily one of the best ice-cream stores in town. Loved them when I was in LA and so glad they opened one here. Why not 5 stars? Their Coffee and Bourbon is the best ice cream I've had and they don't have that in SF. Tried the other coffee flavors and they are just not the same.
author: Ra T.

description: Interesting and unique flavors with probably the best waffle cone I've tasted in SF. I'm glad sampling the various flavors is such a big part of the experience! Great place to get ice cream - would recommend to anyone!
author: Kris P.

description:
I was SO excited to learn they were adding a Salt & Straw to Hayes Valley. For those ice cream aficionados who prefer to venture beyond the vanillas of the world (though they also have a Double Fold Vanilla flavor which is among the better vanillas I have tried), Portland-born Salt & Straw is its own special oasis. Their flavors are innovative, often combining sweet and salty elements and incorporating local ingredients (the SF locations have a Sightglass Coffee & Single Origin Dandelion Chocolate flavor, as well as an Almond Brittle with Salted Ganache that incorporates locally produced almond brittle).

I am also always delighted by their seasonal flavors, which change monthly and include a wide selection. For January, their theme was "Vegan New Year", for which they incorporated a selection of alarmingly creamy vegan flavors. My go-to order among their unchanging classic menu is Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches (which might strike some as a little sweet and includes ribbons of strawberry delight and chunks of cake rather than the pink monotony of classic strawberry), or Almond Brittle with Salted Ganache. If you go at a prime time (think weekend afternoons on a hot day or after lunch or dinner), don't be surprised if there is a line. The employees are super friendly and will let you taste as many flavors as you desire, which certainly helps validate the time consumption. Salt & Straw is a bit on the pricy side, but it is a boutique ice cream shop in SF (what else would one expect?) and is certainly worth the cost in my opinion. Pro tip: Consider buying a pint for $11 and skipping the line.
author: Kristen G.

description: Really good ice cream.  I got the tree keches. It tasted like a sweet cake. Can t go wrong here
author: Ford W.

description: Loved the honey lavender and sightglass coffee with Tcho!  Was amazed it was still open when we got there after 10:30pm on a weekday night.  There was a line but it moved pretty fast.  Will come again!  I loved the local ingredients mixed into their flavors, the decor and the friendly staff.
author: Eva S.

description: Random flavors of ice cream that end up working together...."cream corn and waffle cone" seriously? but it works.
author: Ian P.

description:
usually a line but so worth it! parking can be difficult for the area.

i don't usually try their funky seasonal flavors; i like to stick with the strawberry tres leches and the sea salt caramel.
author: Megan Y.

description: Delicious and out of the ordinary. Try their Almond Brittle w/ salted Ganache or their Honey Lavender...they were amazing!!!
author: Wara B.

description: Swirl flavors are interesting but that's it, the ice cream is bland.  To bad they don't make it locally, it's probably better in Portland.  Stick with the locally made ice cream and gelato Jobs.
author: phil b.

description:
First things first: ROASTED STRAWBERRY COCONUT FLAVOR IS AMAZING!! The BEST dairy free/vegan ice cream I've ever had. The scoops are very large- one scoop is easily enough. It would be great if they had more dairy free options! 
Minus one star because of the very tiny portion of hot fudge added when paid extra for it. It was almost a joke it was so little. 

Went in around 4:30pm on a Monday and there were a few ppl in line but only took about 5 minutes in and out.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I know this place is all the rage but none of the flavors work for me. 

Moreover, I like "artisanal" places to have artisanal-type staff. The staff here is unconversant with ingredients or process or the local chocolate+ice cream ecosystem. Last straw: staff last week had never heard of Tcho (not good chocolate, but I mean, come ON.). 

Staff also seems not very interested in customer service, which is surprising, given the $$ range of products.
author: C J.

description:
give them the 4 star for their staff and their sweet personality. the ice cream are a little bit too sweet for me.

be patient at the line and when you are being served don't be shy asking them for many flavor to taste before making your choice.

best time to be at this place would be around 3 to 5 pm I believe.

the later it is the more busy it gets.
author: Wai C.

description: Poor Customer Service. Person serving us had a bad attitude and after a long wait, gave us our sundae that was spilling over, leaking everywhere (horribly prepared) - MOST CONCERNING WAS.... that we found 2 sharp edged pieces of plastic inside our sundae (not from the spoon may I add, black spoon and clear plastic). Our children almost choked on this plastic. Very disappointing. I don't think we can support this business again. Look out!
author: Amanda M.

description: Incredible ice cream! Worth going out of your way to try. We got the olive oil lemon curd, gooey brownie, ginger bread cookie dough, and peppermint cocoa. Everything was amazing! 10 out of 10. Also tried a sample of their double fold vanilla, best vanilla I've ever tried.
author: Brandon F.

description: Great ice cream shop! The ice cream was amazing the customer service was amazing and the price wasn't bank breaking. Had heard a lot about Salt and Straw and it definitely lived up to my expectations.
author: Eric L.

description: PHENOMENAL treats for the whole family! The textures, flavors, and inventiveness of this company are so refreshing! I had a double scoop of (1) Black Olive Brittle & Goat Cheese w/ (2) Sea Salt w/ Caramel Ribbons and it was SO DECADENT!! The line outside was gasping and oohing at it as I walked out! Waiting in line for 25 mins and taking a chance on something new is completely part of what made our trip to the city well-worth the time. Will definitely return as the whole family agreed it needs to be a tradition.
author: Katy T.

description: I give your ice cream a 5 stars, however the customer service at the Hayes location is not up to par at all; at least to my standards. It's a shame because I highly enjoy the ice cream and I'm always so excited to take a break from work from the Civic Center and get some delicious ice cream to make my day. However, I've been here 3 times now in about a month span and every time I've gone, the service is horrible and it's never busy (because it's a weekday and during lunch). This third time I brought  my two co-workers to introduce them to these lovely flavors and we all walked out due to horrible customer service and that was my last straw since I came two previous times and disregarded the employee's behaviors. At this point i'm extremely hesitant to return to this location. I've been to the Portland, LA, and San Diego stores and all have been a wonderful experience however every time I've come to the Hayes location, the service is trash. I hope they get it together and hire individuals that are enthusiastic about helping customers and providing yummy ice cream because instead of purchasing the wonderful product there, I just went else where.
author: Marichelle B.

description: They have really weird flavors I wish I could have tried. I got the chocolate brownie and it was delicious. Their chocolate ganache was a little too salty for my taste. Service is fast. If you want two flavors but too full you can split the scoop
author: Brian N.

description: Good ice cream but for me did not taste as good as the one in Portland. Might come back to try another flavor to see if it's the flavor that was off.
author: Elena Y.

description: Solid place and quite artisan. Their honey lavender tastes like what it sounds like and it was delicious. They let you try as many flavors as you'd like so that's definitely a nice plus before committing to any flavor!
author: Eden W.

description: Having a severe peanut allergy, I usually can't eat at most ice cream places due to cross contamination. However, the friendly staff were more than accommodating to my allergy and made me feel extremely safe! After telling me which flavors I could have with my allergy, she went back and opened a fresh carton, using a disinfected scoop to ensure no cross contamination. Upon thanking her she said, "no allergy should stop you from ice cream!" What lovely staff! I will definitely be back.
author: Emily H.

description: They have some cool and unique ice cream flavor but I'm just not a fan. I sampled most of their ice cream and still had a hard time choosing because it wasn't good and some flavors just didn't go well. I ended up getting one of their best seller and it was too sweet for me. I might give this place another try though.
author: Luna C.

description: i got the honey lavender ice cream and it was so amazing! so many unique flavors to choose from, and staff was helpful in letting myself and everyone around me try as many flavors as we wanted without making us feel bad! totally worth the line!
author: Maggie C.

description: Had the honey lavender kids scoop and it was amazing! The cone is unbelievable! Took my parents in law again, and it was a successful also!
author: Anat S.

description: I was just hanging out and needed some ice cream. Checked this place out. The flavors are interesting. Especially the thanksgiving menu. Maybe it's just me so don't let me stop you! My issue is that although the flavors were fun and interesting the actual ice cream as a whole fell flat to me. I also didn't like any of the chocolate flavors and chocolate is my jam!
author: Eric S.

description: New favorite ice cream spot in the city! The "Teranga Baobab Juice & Coconut" is sooo good, I hope they make more vegan flavors. The scoops are really generous and the staff are friendly. It's conveniently in Hayes Valley too
author: Maggie L.

description: Amazing ice cream - really happy with our experience despite a line out the door when we arrived late on a Sunday evening. Love their ever-changing flavors and odd fixings. The October flavors are especially delicious - the Candycopia was my personal favorite. Really well-operated shop, great customer service overall.
author: Rachel S.

description: Easy five stars. Friendly staff, fast service, fairly priced (pro tip: split the double scoop with a friend to get a better bang for the buck). Flavors spanned from variations on the traditional (double vanilla, chocolate brownie) to the exotic (olive oil and lemon custard, caramelized grapefruit eggnog). A good alternative to Smitten if you're in Hayes Valley.
author: James L.

description: Service here sucks! Came here on a Thursday night & the guy who helped us , tall slender guy was so rude! He slammed my ice cream down. Ice cream was way too salty for my liking. My friend recommend me here but will not come back!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Today was my first time ever visiting Salt & Straw and I had an amazing first experience. The ice cream was great, but the customer service Kim provided was phenomenal. Kim was very sweet and welcoming to the store, she provided us with knowledge on all of the ice cream we asked about. Kim thank you so much for being so great and working so hard, I hope you are rewarded for your great customer service and hard work. As I work in customer service I am very mindful when I visit places around the city. Thanks again Kim, I will definitely be back!
author: Myles R.

description: They were friendly and the strawberry tres leches flavor was amazing, but the other flavor I got with the salt ganache was too much. I like the Polly Anns ice cream place better.
author: Hiroka M.

description: This place has fantastic ice cream with lots of variety.  Xander was our scooper and he really looked like he was having fun back there and somehow... It really did make the ice cream and the whole experience better.  Thank you Xander!
author: David N.

description: I loooove this place. The staff is always so friendly and it's well worth the wait. I paired the olive oil with the lavender, and it was to salivate for. If I hadn't had to do more afterwards I would have purchased some of their take home ice cream. This place is so yummy I wish they had one in Sacramento County.
author: E J.

description: Average and overpriced ice cream with a 30-minute+ wait. I don't get it. I got their famous dark chocolate flavor.
author: Chris B.

description: This place has some of the unique flavors I've had for ice-cream.  Their monthly seasonal flavors are great.  For Halloween they included critters and pigs blood.  While I wasn't brave enough to try those, I did try their other Halloween flavors and their flavors for this month which include pumpkin and goat cheese and sweet potato and they were great. Service is great too and so far I haven't had to wait in line much, even though the first time I went it was still relatively new and warm.
author: a f.

description: The staff is super nice and approachable! They did not rush us to order or seemed annoyed when we asked try multiple flavours (also, luckily there was no line when we went so there was no pressure from the other customers to rush either). I love their fun seasonal flavours and it's always a pleasure to try their new creations.
author: Angel G.

description: I usually visit the Fillmore location, but I happened to be in the area one day. At both locations, the employees are really helpful and patient while you decide which flavors you want. I generally get a couple of the flavors of the month - I love that there's new and interesting flavor combinations to try every month.  When I was visited the Hayes Valley location during Halloween, I was helped by a really nice woman, who took her time to explain all the monthly flavors to us and I really appreciated it!
author: whatever I.

description: Hands down, the best ice cream in San Francisco- better than Bi-Rite, better than Humphrey, better than Mitchell's, seriously, do yourself a favor, go here now.
author: Micah S.

description: Tried this place since we were in the area but were a bit skeptical since there were so few reviews. There were four of us and all flavors were delicious. Not sure the name exactly but the peach cobbler one was our favorite. Staff is so friendly and helpful and lets you sample multiple flavors (sometimes to a fault as lady in front of us tried seven).  Everything is organic and farm fresh. Worth the wait!
author: Cheryl R.
